005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.constraint;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.markup.MarkupLine;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.constraint.impl.DefaultAllowedValue;
010
011import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
012
013/**
014 * Represents an individual enumerated value associated with an
015 * {@link IAllowedValuesConstraint}.
016 */
017public interface IAllowedValue {
018  /**
019   * Construct a new allowed value entry for use in an
020   * {@link IAllowedValuesConstraint}.
021   *
022   * @param value
023   *          the allowed value
024   * @param description
025   *          a textual description of the value
026   * @return the new allowed value
027   */
028  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ShortMethodName")
029  @NonNull
030  static IAllowedValue of(
031      @NonNull String value,
032      @NonNull MarkupLine description) {
033    // TODO: add support for deprecated version
034    return new DefaultAllowedValue(value, description, null);
035  }
036
037  /**
038   * Retrieves the enumerated value associated with this allowed value constraint
039   * entry.
040   *
041   * @return the value
042   */
043  @NonNull
044  String getValue();
045
046  /**
047   * If the value is deprecated, get the deprecated version.
048   *
049   * @return the deprecated version or {@code null} if the value is not deprecated
050   */
051  String getDeprecatedVersion();
052
053  /**
054   * Retrieves the enumerated value's description associated with this allowed
055   * value constraint entry.
056   *
057   * @return the description
058   */
059  @NonNull
060  MarkupLine getDescription();
061}
